itemDescription: British heir, investment banker, horse breeder and philanthropist (1946-2009)

wikipedia_page.main: Richard Alexander Hambro (1 October 1946 – 25 April 2009) was a British heir, investment banker, horse breeder and philanthropist.

response: *Richard Hambro (1946–2009), British investment banker, horsebreeder and philanthropist
He acquired Wiltons, a fine restaurant located at 55 Jermyn Street in London, during World War II.Richard Hambro, The Daily Telegraph, 7 May 2009

The firm was established as J. O. Hambro Investment Management in 1986.Tanzeel Akhtar, JO Hambro rebrands as Waverton Investment Management, Interactive Investor, 13 January 2014 It was co-founded by Richard Hambro, Lord Balniel, and David Chaplin.Emiliya Mychasuk, Emiko Terazono, Hambro era shift, Financial Times, 28 May 2009 It was named in honor of Richard Hambro's father, Jocelyn Olaf Hambro. It is a completely separate company from J.O. Hambro Capital Management.
